resources.string: NHS COVID-19
COVID-19
This NHS app does three things for you:
It lets you know if you have been near someone who now has coronavirus
It links you to up-to-date guidance on coronavirus that is relevant to your situation
It lets you book a test if you have certain symptoms of coronavirus
You will not be tracked and your personal identity and location history will remain protected at all times. On an Android phone, your location permission is needed for Bluetooth to work.

string.name: explanation_link
string.u: Learn more about how the app works

resources.string: This app uses battery-saving Bluetooth Low Energy to determine when it is near another phone with this app. For this app to work, Bluetooth needs to be kept on at all times.
You have been near someone who has tested positive for coronavirus. Please self-isolate.
Your test result indicates you have coronavirus. Please isolate yourself and your household.

colocate-contact-and-checkin
Coronavirus notifications
Start main activity
Your advice has changed
Please open the app to learn what to do next. Your help saves lives.
Your test result has arrived
Your test result has arrived. Please open the app to learn what to do next. You have been sent an email or text with more information.
Set up app permissions
Bluetooth
Location
Continue
How the app works

This app gives you advice if you have been near someone who tested positive for coronavirus after reporting symptoms. The app uses your phone to detect other app users nearby.

If you think you have coronavirus symptoms you can add them in this app. If you then test positive, the NHS will let others know they have been near someone who has tested positive for coronavirus.

Your identity is not shared with other app users. The NHS will protect your identity. All information is stored securely.
Go back
For debug purposes only. Your sonar Id is:
Please turn Bluetooth on
This app can only protect you and others if Bluetooth is on all the time
Enable Bluetooth
Please turn Location on
This app can only protect you and others if Location is on all the time
Go to your Settings
Do you have a high temperature (fever)?
Do you have a high temperature (fever)?

This means that you feel hot to touch on your chest or back (you do not need to measure your temperature).\n\nYour response to this question helps us decide whether you need to book a coronavirus test.
This means that you feel hot to touch on your chest or back (you do not need to measure your temperature)
Yes, I have a high temperature
No, I do not have a high temperature
Do you have a new continuous cough?
Do you have a continuous cough?

This means coughing a lot for more than an hour, or 3 or more coughing episodes in 24 hours (if you usually have a cough, it may be worse than usual).\n\nYour response to this question helps us decide whether you need to book a coronavirus test.
This means coughing a lot for more than an hour, or 3 or more coughing episodes in 24 hours (if you usually have a cough, it may be worse than usual).
Yes, I have a new continuous cough
No, I do not have a new continuous cough
Yes, I have a continuous cough
No, I do not have a continuous cough
Have you had a new loss or change to your sense of smell or taste?
Have you had a loss or change to your sense of smell or taste?

This means you have noticed you cannot smell or taste anything, or things smell or taste different to normal.\n\nYour response to this question helps us decide whether you need to book a coronavirus test.
This means you have noticed you cannot smell or taste anything, or things smell or taste different to normal.
Yes, I have a new loss or change to my sense of smell or taste
No, I do not have a new loss or change to my sense of smell or taste
Do you have a runny nose, feel feverish or suffer from sneezing?
Do you have a runny nose, feel feverish or suffer from sneezing?

Runny nose: this means your nose is more runny than usual.

Feeling feverish: this means you have sore or aching muscles, feel unusually tired, have a headache or are shivering or feeling warm or hot.

Sneezing: this means you are sneezing more than normal, not caused by any known allergy.

Your response to this question helps the NHS better understand coronavirus.

Runny nose: this means your nose is more runny than usual.

Feeling feverish: this means you have sore or aching muscles, feel unusually tired, have a headache or are shivering or feeling warm or hot.

Sneezing: this means you are sneezing more than normal, not caused by any known allergy.
Do you have diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting or have a loss of appetite?
Do you have diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting or have a loss of appetite?

Diarrhoea: this means your poo has been more runny or watery than normal.

Nausea: this means you are feeling sick.

Vomiting: this means you have been sick more than once.

Loss of appetite: this means you are not feeling hungry, or are not eating as much as normal.

Your response to this question helps the NHS better understand coronavirus.

Diarrhoea: this means your poo has been more runny or watery than normal.

Nausea: this means you are feeling sick.

Vomiting: this means you have been sick more than once.

Loss of appetite: this means you are not feeling hungry, or are not eating as much as normal.
Yes, I have at least one of these symptoms
No, I don\'t have any of these symptoms
Submit
Select yes if you have at least one of these symptoms
Select yes if you have recently lost your sense of smell or taste
Select yes if you have a high temperature
Select yes if you have a continuous cough
Add my symptoms
I feel unwell
I might have symptoms of coronavirus and want to know what to do next.
Follow the current advice to stop the spread of coronavirus
Your symptoms indicate you may have coronavirus. Please isolate yourself and your household and book a test.
Find your NHS services for your part of the country

resources.string: How are you feeling today?
Finalising setup…
The app is working properly
Enter the first part of your home postcode

This information will be used to help your local NHS respond to the coronavirus in your area and to understand the spread of the disease across the UK. Your postcode will not be used to track your location.
Please enter the first part of a valid postcode. For example: PO30, E2, M1, EH1, L36
This app can let you know if you may have been near someone with coronavirus symptoms (COVID-19).
When did you first start showing any of these symptoms?
Today
Yesterday
Select a different date…
Start date
Close
You do not appear to have coronavirus symptoms
If you are showing other symptoms, or think you may have coronavirus, please visit

I have a high temperature
I don\'t have a high temperature
I have a new continuous cough
I don\'t have a new continuous cough
I have recently lost my sense of smell
I have not recently lost my sense of smell
I have at least one of these symptoms: a runny nose, feeling feverish or sneezing
I don\'t have any of these symptoms: a runny nose, feeling feverish or sneezing
I have at least one of these symptoms: diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting or loss of appetite
I don\'t have any of these symptoms: diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting or loss of appetite
Select the date you first started showing any of these symptoms
Please update your symptoms to view your latest advice.

Thank you for getting tested. You have been sent an email with more information.\n\nIf you are having symptoms, please update your symptoms to see the latest advice for you. If you do not have any symptoms, you can now follow the advice for the general public.
Update my symptoms
I no longer have symptoms
Thank you for updating your symptoms
Although you still have some symptoms you can now stop self-isolating and follow the current advice for the general public.
Okay
Your permission is needed to allow the use of Bluetooth

This app uses battery-saving Bluetooth Low Energy to determine when it is near another phone with this app installed. For this to work, Bluetooth needs to be kept on at all times. 

Using Bluetooth means that the app cannot track your location and your privacy remains protected.

If you do not give permission for Bluetooth this app will not work.

To give permission for this app to access Bluetooth, please go to Settings and allow access
Enable Bluetooth
Your permission is needed to allow access to your location all the time
Your permission is needed to allow access to your location

This app does not use your location to track you. Your personal identity will remain protected at all times.

This app uses battery-saving Bluetooth Low Energy to determine when it is near another phone with this app installed. For this app to work, Bluetooth needs to be kept on at all times.

On an Android phone, your location permission needs to be set to “Allow all the time” for Bluetooth Low Energy to work.

To enable this app to work, please go to App Settings > Permissions and allow access:

This app does not use your location to track you. Your personal identity will remain protected at all times.

This app uses battery-saving Bluetooth Low Energy to determine when it is near another phone with this app installed. For this app to work, Bluetooth needs to be kept on at all times.

On an Android phone, your location permission is needed for Bluetooth Low Energy to work.

To enable this app to work, please go to App Settings > Permissions and allow access:
Go to App Settings
Go to your Settings
You need to enable location services on your phone

To make Bluetooth work, we need you to turn on location services on your phone.

This app is not using Bluetooth or your location to track you. Your personal identity will remain protected at all times.

This app uses battery-saving Bluetooth Low Energy to determine when it is near another phone with this app installed. For this to work, Bluetooth needs to be kept on at all times. 

If you do not enable location services on your phone this app will not work.

To enable this app to work, please go to Settings and enable location services:
Please follow the advice below until
On %1$s
this app will notify you to update your symptoms. Please read your full advice below.
If you do not have any symptoms, there’s no need to do anything right now. If you develop symptoms, please come back to this app.
Feel free to use other apps as normal and you’ll be notified if your advice changes.
If you develop symptoms, please come back to this app.
Please turn your Bluetooth back on

This app works only if your Bluetooth is on at all times.\n\n%1$s works using Bluetooth signals, to determine when you have been near someone else with this app who shows symptoms of coronavirus. %1$s can alert you or others that may be at risk.
Turn on location services on your phone to continue

To make Bluetooth work, we also need you to turn on location services. Your location will not be tracked. Your location and personal identity will remain protected.

To enable your location you need to turn on your location services on your phone.

%1$s works using Bluetooth signals, to determine when you have been near someone else with this app who shows symptoms of coronavirus.
Allow this app to access your location to continue

To make Bluetooth work, we also need you to turn on location services and give the app permission to use it. Your location will not be tracked. Your location and personal identity will remain protected.

To enable your location permissions you need to go to your Settings and allow this app to access location services.

%1$s works using Bluetooth signals, to determine when you have been near someone else with this app who shows symptoms of coronavirus.

Why do we need this?

Open App
How are you feeling today?
Please open the app to update your symptoms and view your latest advice. Your help saves lives.
Your phone does not support Bluetooth Low Energy sufficiently for this app to work
We continue to validate and expand the number of mobile devices capable of using the NHS COVID-19 app. Find more information on Bluetooth Low Energy here:
The information you have provided will be used to help protect your community and the NHS. The NHS needs accurate data on the number of people with symptoms.
Together we can help save lives, protect the NHS, and stop the spread of coronavirus in the UK.

This app is made for mobile smartphones

Your device seems to be a tablet. This app is only available for smartphones because the app is only effective if you have it on a device that is with you all the time when you go out. Please install the app on your smartphone.
You will not receive important notifications regarding changes in your advice unless you allow notifications in your Settings.
Enable notifications
Timestamp %1$s
TxPower: \nAdvertised = %1$d \nProtocol = %2$d
Book a coronavirus test now
You can now book a coronavirus test for you and other people in your household. This test will tell you whether you currently have coronavirus or not.
In order for this app to receive your test result, please write down or copy into the clipboard this 8-digit app reference code as you will be asked for it later.
Get tested
Information about testing
When you need a test
If you have symptoms let this app know and it can help you order a coronavirus test.
When you don\’t need a test
You do not need a test if you have been near someone who has developed symptoms or tested positive for coronavirus, unless you have symptoms yourself.
Linking a test to this app
Your app reference code
Please connect your phone to the internet to see the app reference code.
In order for this app to receive your test result, you will be asked for this 8-digit app reference code later.
Copy
Copied
Read the latest guidance for your workplace
The guidance on GOV.UK is specific to the industry you work in and helps you understand how to work safely during the coronavirus pandemic.
If you are a health and care worker:

Turn off your Bluetooth when you put on your personal protective equipment provided for you by your employer. Your interactions at work should not be captured when you are wearing personal protective equipment.
Next Steps
Read current advice for you
Read current advice
If you develop symptoms, please come back to this app.
More Options
App version:
Your test result indicates that you do not have coronavirus
Thank you for getting tested. View your current advice based on your results. You have been sent an email or text with more information.
Read and follow advice specific to your situation
The advice below is up-to-date and specific to your situation. Please follow this advice.
The advice below is up-to-date and specific to your situation. Please follow this advice until %1$s
Your test result indicates that you have coronavirus
Thank you for getting tested. View your current advice based on your results. You have been sent an email with more information.
Your test result was unclear
Thank you for getting tested. However, due to an unclear test result your advice has not been changed. Please book another test. You have been sent an email with more information.
If you have a medical emergency, please call 999. If you require medical help near you, please go to 111 online.
